content.description:
This is really just a variation of

Soul Grind

, but it was slightly different enough to want to share.

Sit start in the same crimp as

Soul Grind

, and move up to the sandy rail. From there, match and dyno up and to the left where you'll find a good shelf. After the dyno, get high feet and mantle to the top. There's also a bump up on the top to grab, but I found it difficult to see.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter will work just fine.
content.location:
This problem is right in the center of the Bass Rhythm Rock.

You can downclimb on the back side or slide down the southwest corner and hop on another rock below.

content.description:
Soul Grind sit starts from a pair of juggy crimps and then climbs straight up the overhang to a solid topout.

The crux involves a right hand static slap to the sloped lip, which then sets up a left hand throw to the positive lip out left.  The movement is fun but is also quite contrived.
content.protection: Pad and a spot, great landing though.
content.location:
Soul Grind is on the west-face of Bass Rhythm Rock, the problem climbs between

Master At Arms

and

Battle Of The Bulge

.

content.description: Sit start with matched hands on a decent jug. From there, work up and left to a big flake/hueco, then hit the lip and top it out.
content.protection: Pad and a spot, great landing though.
content.location: This is on Bass Rhythm Rock's west face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a decent jug, from there work up and far right on the overhang to the lip and top it out.
content.protection: Pad and spot, good landing though.
content.location: This is on the West face of Bass Rhythm Rock.
